HDG.IM.content: [method contra Nietzsche] unfolding that which was realized through Nietzsche by truly engaged attack on him > is Nietzsche final victim of fall out of Being? witness to a new necessity?
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [method contra Nietzsche] unfolding that which was realized through Nietzsche by truly engaged attack on him > is Nietzsche final victim of fall out of Being? witness to a new necessity?

HDG.IM.content: fall, bad times: flight of gods, destruction of earth, reduction of human beings to a mass, preeminence of mediocre [aren’t these all Nietzschean?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: fall, bad times: flight of gods, destruction of earth, reduction of human beings to a mass, preeminence of mediocre [aren’t these all Nietzschean?]

HDG.BT.content: Dasein falls prey to tradition, which keeps it from providing its own guidance > tradition takes what has come down to us, delivers it to self-evidence, blocks access to primordial ‘sources’ of categories/concepts
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Dasein falls prey to tradition, which keeps it from providing its own guidance > tradition takes what has come down to us, delivers it to self-evidence, blocks access to primordial ‘sources’ of categories/concepts

HDG.FS.content: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heraclitus’ Fragment 72 names humans and their “departure from being (Abkommen vom Sein)” (cf. Being and Time), designates a fall upon/away/from beings (Verfall oder Ab-fall [an das Seinde]) > this fall belongs to Difference (Unterschied) btwn Being/beings, so that Fall of Man sets aside [obscures] this difference > for Heraclitus, the foreign depart from difference [not as antagonistically (feindlich) disposed toward foreign (Fremden) as Plato]

HDG.FS.content: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

HDG.FS.content: Being not forgotten in sense of falling away, nothing negative in forgetting of Being [?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Being not forgotten in sense of falling away, nothing negative in forgetting of Being [?]

HDG.FS.content: nihilating nothing decrees “fall upon beings” [?] > fall (Verfall) not as falling away from (Abfallen von), but as ontological/natural condition of Dasein (Being and Time not leading everyday Dasein to thematization of Being)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: nihilating nothing decrees “fall upon beings” [?] > fall (Verfall) not as falling away from (Abfallen von), but as ontological/natural condition of Dasein (Being and Time not leading everyday Dasein to thematization of Being)

HDG.MA.content: so firmly shackled to technical devices, fall in bondage to them > we can affirm unavoidable use of technical devices, also deny them right to dominate us [prosthetic usage?]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: so firmly shackled to technical devices, fall in bondage to them > we can affirm unavoidable use of technical devices, also deny them right to dominate us [prosthetic usage?]

HDG.EC.content: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [can’t pass judgment on ontology of world-event] devastation comes forth from being, is a world-event (Weltereignis) that beleaguers (umlagert) the earth > person who passes judgment falls prey to quarreling/annoyance that gnaw at him, he becomes slave to self-righteousness (Selbstgerechtigkeit) [Nietzsche on revenge dimming one’s own eyes]

HDG.OHF.content: for faith, man is “fallen,” his being-fallen not derived from God, but state into which man brought himself [explanation of Kant-like co-givenness of man’s goodness & his possibility of falling] > primordial experience of being-sinful (Sündigseins) at particular time: closed context of experience, basis of anthropology of Christian theology > [Nietzsche-like] God-relation (as constitutive) neutralized into consciousness of norms/values, center of acts (archē), “Ego-pole”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: for faith, man is “fallen,” his being-fallen not derived from God, but state into which man brought himself [explanation of Kant-like co-givenness of man’s goodness & his possibility of falling] > primordial experience of being-sinful (Sündigseins) at particular time: closed context of experience, basis of anthropology of Christian theology > [Nietzsche-like] God-relation (as constitutive) neutralized into consciousness of norms/values, center of acts (archē), “Ego-pole”

HDG.OHF.content: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present
